Title: Animal Care Assistant
RoleDescription: We are hiring!Here at Overdale Veterinary Practice, we are looking for a friendly and caring Animal Care Assistant to join our fantastic tam in Buxton. This role will report to the Head Nurse or Nurse Manager. You will also have the opportunity to enrol on and complete a recognised Level 2 VCA apprenticeship qualification or complete the IVC Evidensia VCA internal 3-month programme. Your responsibilities will include:*Maintain a high standard of inpatient care under direction of the VS or RVN. *Communicate with the supervising VS and RVN on basic status of inpatients. *Communicate effectively with clients when performing reception and client-based duties and maintain a high professional standard.  *Assist with setting up for clinical procedures and support the VS and RVN in all required procedures. *Establish and maintain a good working relationship with all members of the practice.  *Always adhere to IVC Evidensia policies and animal welfare standards. *Adhere to all SOPs and implement updates where required. *Maintain a high standard of cleanliness and biosecurity throughout the building. *Fulfil the obligations of the rota, sick cover/on call rota & bank holiday cover. *Support the practice with new initiatives. *Carry out any reasonable requests made by members of the management team. Your duties will include:*Monitor and recording inpatients clinical parameters, including TPR, bodily functions and activity and identifying changes and communicate with the supervising VS and RVN on basic status/change in status of inpatients. *Ensure the highest standard of nursing care is always delivered to all patients under direction of the VS or RVN (not exceeding professional remit). *Ensure the patients needs are met via provision of environmental enrichment opportunities and meeting individual needs of the animal to reduce distress, pain, fear and frustration. *Provide psychological support to manage stress and patient anxiety, to include stroking, cuddling, handfeeding, and providing comfort and emotional care to inpatients. *Provide physical support, including exercising the patient to ensure opportunities for elimination and providing mobility support where required. *Provide individual feeding support (hand feed, provision of preferred feeding bowls etc) to ensure the patient is receiving correct nutrition and support the patient in getting back to normal feeding and drinking behaviour. *Appropriately move and restrain animals for treatment and procedures, this may include for blood tests, injections, claw clipping, ultrasound, etc. *Support the clinical team and client with end-of-life care and support. The clinic has a classical feel about it, with the ethos of providing a high standard of clinical care to our clients across the board.  We have 3 small animal consulting rooms (2 vet and 1 nurse), one dedicated operating theatre, an imaging suite (digital x-ray, ultrasound and endoscopy plus Dental x-ray arriving soon...), prep area with dental facilities and in house laboratory. We have separate cat and dog kennels. Title: Student Veterinary Nurse
RoleDescription: We are looking for an enthusiastic, dynamic Student Veterinary Nurse to join our friendly team in the beautiful cathedral city of Salisbury.  If you are an animal lover who wants to pursue a career in Veterinary Nursing, we want to hear from you.  Your role with us would be full-time, working 40 hours a week, gathering knowledge by working alongside our experienced registered veterinary nurses, vets and reception staff.  The right candidate would then be put through training to become a veterinary nurse.  The position includes attending Lynwood School of Veterinary Nursing one day a week, completing assignments, written and practical examinations and the Central Skills Log (CSL). The entry requirements for the Veterinary Nursing course are as follows:Students must be 16 years or older to commence training and must have achieved a minimum level of education qualifications either 5 GCSEs at grade C or above (now graded as 4 - 9) or 5 Scottish grades 1 to 3.  These passes must include English Language, Mathematics, Science and 2 additional subjects.  Alternative qualifications of a comparable or higher standard may be accepted at the discretion of the awarding body.For the level 3 Diploma in Veterinary Nursing, students cannot apply to come onto the course unless they have secured a position within an RCVS training practice as an employed member of staff and completed at least 3 months probation with their training practice.The veterinary nursing apprenticeship is completed over 3 years and includes 24 months of theoretical teaching and a further 12 months of developing practical skills.  Student veterinary nurses are required to complete a mandatory minimum of 2,990 hours of training with a minimum of 1,800 hours of practical experience at an approved training practice.Skills that you will learn and be expected to carry out to the highest standard include animal handling and husbandry, reception tasks, maintaining cleanliness and caring for inpatients.
